cells.data: Mac OS X does not have a /proc file system. Therefore resolving the absolute path and other process informations have to be obtained in a different fashion. OS X has the libproc library, which can be used to gather different process informations. In order to find the absolute path for a given PID, the following code can be used:

I was surprised not to be able to easily find documentation for pid information, which in my opinion is quite trivial to be implemented. I had to go through the code of lsof to fing the implementation for reading proc txt section and finally learn about proc_pidinfo. proc_pidpath is just a wrapper for proc_pidinfo to resolve the path.
